00017 void Obstacle_map::Load(std::ifstream& data)
00018 {
00019         //Todo: Make sure loading works, on all platforms.
00020         std::string tileset_file;
00021 
00022         Attributes attributes;
00023 
00024         std::string line;
00025         while (seek_non_comment_line(data, line))
00026         {
00027                 if ("</obstaclemap>" == line)
00028                 {
00029                         /* Used to only need to type attribute name once: prevents typos */
00030                         std::string attributeName;
00031 
00032                         if (attributes.end() != attributes.find("width") && attributes.end() != attributes.find("height"))
00033                         {
00034                                 Show_attributes(std::cout, attributes);
00035 
00036                                 /* Read in [row x column] points if both height and width are
00037                                  * specified.
00038                                  *
00039                                  * If one or the other is not defined, do nothing.
00040                                  */
00041                                 attributeName = "width";
00042                                 int width = String_to_type<int>(attributes[attributeName]);
00043                                 attributes.erase(attributeName);
00044 
00045                                 attributeName = "height";
00046                                 int height = String_to_type<int>(attributes[attributeName]);
00047                                 attributes.erase(attributeName);
00048 
00049                                 tilemap.resize(width);
00050                                 for (int y = 0; y < height; ++y)
00051                                 {
00052                                         /* Convert the current row into a number.  Then find the
00053                                          * "0 = ..." pair using that number/index.
00054                                          */
00055                                         std::stringstream row;
00056                                         row << y;
00057                                         if (attributes.end() != attributes.find(row.str()))
00058                                         {
00059                                                 // Pull in the entire string value to a stream
00060                                                 std::stringstream col(attributes[row.str()]);
00061                                                 for (Tilemap::iterator c = tilemap.begin(); c < tilemap.end(); ++c)
00062                                                 {
00063                                                         int index;
00064                                                         col >> index;
00065                                                         c->push_back(1 == index);
00066                                                 }
00067                                         }
00068                                 }
00069                         }
00070 
00071                         // Once the closing tag is found, do not scan the file any further.
00072                         break;
00073                 }
00074 
00075                 //Store name, value pair in attributes
00076                 std::string name;
00077                 std::vector<std::string> value;
00078 
00079                 /* Ensure that the line has a valid "name=value" pair, else we will
00080                  * see problems.
00081                  */
00082                 if (true == name_and_value(line, name, value))
00083                 {
00084                         /* Until we figure out how to have multiple values with the same
00085                          * name, we're only going to be able to take the first one...
00086                          */
00087                         attributes[name] = value[0];
00088                 }
00089         }
00090 
00091 //      int width;
00092 //      int height;
00093 //      data>>width;
00094 //      data>>height;
00095 //
00096 //      data>>tilesize_x;
00097 //      data>>tilesize_y;
00098 //
00099 //      tilemap.resize(width);
00100 //      for (int y = 0; y < height; ++y)
00101 //      {
00102 //              for (Tilemap::iterator c = tilemap.begin(); c < tilemap.end(); ++c)
00103 //              {
00104 //                      char index;
00105 //                      data>>index;
00106 //                      c->push_back(index == '1');
00107 //              }
00108 //      }
00109 }

00112 bool Obstacle_map::Line_collision(const Vector& from, const Vector& to, Collision_data& data)
00113 {
00114         //Todo: Fill in collision data
00115 
00116         Vector diff = to - from;
00117         float xslope = diff.X()/diff.Y();
00118         float yslope = diff.Y()/diff.X();
00119 
00120         float block=-1;
00121 
00122         float x = from.X();
00123         if (diff.X() > 0)
00124         {
00125                 for (x = int(x / tile_w) * tile_w + tile_w; x < to.X(); x += tile_w)
00126                 {
00127                         float y = from.Y() + yslope * (x-from.X());
00128                         if (Point_blocked(Vector(x, y)))
00129                         {
00130                                 block = (x-from.X())/diff.X();
00131                                 break;
00132                         }
00133                 }
00134         }
00135         if (diff.X() < 0)
00136         {
00137                 for (x = int(x / tile_w) * tile_w - 1; x > to.X(); x -= tile_w)
00138                 {
00139                         float y = from.Y() + yslope * (x-from.X());
00140                         if (Point_blocked(Vector(x, y)))
00141                         {
00142                                 block = (x-from.X())/diff.X();
00143                                 break;
00144                         }
00145                 }
00146         }
00147         float y = from.Y();
00148         if (diff.Y() > 0)
00149         {
00150                 for (y = int(y / tile_h) * tile_h + tile_h; y < to.Y(); y += tile_h)
00151                 {
00152                         float x = from.X() + xslope * (y-from.Y());
00153                         if (Point_blocked(Vector(x, y)))
00154                         {
00155                                 block = (y-from.Y())/diff.Y();
00156                                 break;
00157                         }
00158                 }
00159         }
00160         if (diff.Y() < 0)
00161         {
00162                 for (y = int(y / tile_h) * tile_h - 1; y > to.Y(); y -= tile_h)
00163                 {
00164                         float x = from.X() + xslope * (y-from.Y());
00165                         if (Point_blocked(Vector(x, y)))
00166                         {
00167                                 block = (y-from.Y())/diff.Y();
00168                                 break;
00169                         }
00170                 }
00171         }
00172 /*      For every border x from x1 to x2
00173                 y += yslope*(x-x1);
00174                 control blocked
00175 
00176         For every border y from y1 to y2
00177                 x += xslope*(y-y1);
00178                 control blocked
00179 */
00180         if (block > 0)
00181         {
00182                 return false;
00183         }
00184 
00185         return true;
00186 }

00189 bool Obstacle_map::Circle_collision(const Vector& center, float radius, Collision_data& data)
00190 {
00191         //Todo: implement
00192         /*
00193          * From tile center is on, check if circle goes into neighbouring tiles.
00194          * Diagonally, distance to corners, gives adjustment towards center?
00195          * Along axis, adjustment along axis.
00196         */
00197 
00198         //Todo: fill in collision data
00199 
00200         data.obstacle = this;
00201 
00202         int tile_x = center.X() / tile_w;
00203         int tile_y = center.Y() / tile_h;
00204 
00205         float ontile_x = center.X() - tile_x * tile_w;
00206         float ontile_y = center.Y() - tile_y * tile_h;
00207 
00208         bool ret = false;
00209 
00210         if (ontile_x-radius < 0 && Tile_blocked(tile_x-1, tile_y))
00211         {
00212                 data.adjust+=Vector(radius-ontile_x, 0);
00213                 ret = true;
00214         }
00215 
00216         if (ontile_x+radius > tile_w && Tile_blocked(tile_x+1, tile_y))
00217         {
00218                 data.adjust+=Vector(tile_w - (ontile_x+radius), 0);
00219                 ret = true;
00220         }
00221 
00222         if (ontile_y-radius < 0 && Tile_blocked(tile_x, tile_y-1))
00223         {
00224                 data.adjust+=Vector(0, radius-ontile_y);
00225                 ret = true;
00226         }
00227 
00228         if (ontile_y+radius > tile_h && Tile_blocked(tile_x, tile_y+1))
00229         {
00230                 data.adjust+=Vector(0, tile_h - (ontile_y+radius));
00231                 ret = true;
00232         }
00233 
00234         if (ret)
00235         {
00236                 return true;
00237         }
00238 
00239         float length;
00240         length = Vector(ontile_x, ontile_y).Length();
00241         if (length < radius && Tile_blocked(tile_x-1, tile_y-1))
00242         {
00243                 float percent = (radius-length)/radius;
00244                 data.adjust.Set(ontile_x * percent, ontile_y * percent);
00245                 return true;
00246         }
00247 
00248         length = Vector(ontile_x - tile_w, ontile_y).Length();
00249         if (length < radius  && Tile_blocked(tile_x+1, tile_y-1))
00250         {
00251                 float percent = (radius-length)/radius;
00252                 data.adjust.Set(-(tile_w-ontile_x) * percent, ontile_y * percent);
00253                 return true;
00254         }
00255 
00256         length = Vector(ontile_x - tile_w, ontile_y - tile_h).Length();
00257         if (length < radius && Tile_blocked(tile_x+1, tile_y+1))
00258         {
00259                 float percent = (radius-length)/radius;
00260                 data.adjust.Set(-(tile_w-ontile_x) * percent, -(tile_h-ontile_y) * percent);
00261                 return true;
00262         }
00263 
00264         length = Vector(ontile_x, ontile_y - tile_h).Length();
00265         if (length < radius && Tile_blocked(tile_x-1, tile_y+1))
00266         {
00267                 float percent = (radius-length)/radius;
00268                 data.adjust.Set(ontile_x * percent, -(tile_h-ontile_y) * percent);
00269                 return true;
00270         }
00271 
00272         return false;
00273 }

00275 
00276 bool Obstacle_map::Point_blocked(const Vector& position)
00277 {
00278         unsigned int x = position.X()/tile_w;
00279         unsigned int y = position.Y()/tile_h;
00280         return Tile_blocked(x, y);
00281 }
00282 
00283 
00284 bool Obstacle_map::Tile_blocked(unsigned int x, unsigned int y)
00285 {
00286         if (x < tilemap.size() && y < tilemap[0].size())
00287         {
00288 //              std::cout<<"Tile blocked: "<<tilemap[x][y]<<std::endl;
00289                 return tilemap[x][y];
00290         }
00291         return false;
00292 }

00295 void Obstacle_map::Set_Dimensions(const int& tilew, const int& tileh)
00296 {
00297         tile_w = tilew;
00298         tile_h = tileh;
00299 }
